channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024040571
item.description:
Report E-2024040571

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a UN3266 Pro-Yellow Plus Super Duty Coil Cleaner release from 2 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-ounces of product released to the cardboard packaging and pallet only due to a pallet puncture. The impacted cardboard and pallet wood were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum along with the spent absorbents. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040597
item.description:
Report E-2024040597

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: GOODLETTSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill was found inside of a trailer in Goodlettsville, TN. The spill consists of a combined 1 gallon amount of Sea Foam Motor Treatment (UN1993), which released from 2-1 gallon metal cans due to no dunnage around the contents and they were punctured when loaded against another skid. The liquid impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with Oil Dri and place the contents into a 10 gallon metal drum which was then left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024041352
item.description:
Report X-2024041352

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure tabs. One of the can was dented on the side causing the lid to open up and spill the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024041245
item.description:
Report X-2024041245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles.

item.title: Report X-2024041273
item.description:
Report X-2024041273

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was found. The fiberboard box contained two one liter glass bottles packaged in a plastic bag with styrofoam padding. One of the bottles was broken spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024041272
item.description:
Report X-2024041272

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the MEMH facility. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal jerrycan. The bottom chime on the jerrycan was damaged causing the release. The shipment was placed int a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024040424
item.description:
Report E-2024040424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver stopped at a truck stop in Knoxville, TN on 4/10/2024 around 1140. Upon exiting the truck, the driver noticed there was material leaking from the front of the trailer, onto the front, right tractor tire. The driver called Superior's Regulatory Department. Superior's Regulatory Department called a spill contractor. The spill response contractor arrived and began cleanup efforts. The spill contractor removed most of the drums from the trailer, found the leaking drum (55 gallon steel drum), and then overpacked the leaking drum. Once the leaking drum was overpacked, they cleaned the inside of the trailer. Once the trailer was clean, they reloaded all of the drums back into the trailer. the total amount of material spilled in the trailer was approximately 79 lbs. The only cost incurred will be from the spill contractor. However, we do not have the final bill back yet from the spill contractor.

item.title: Report X-2024040821
item.description:
Report X-2024040821

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. When it was discovered that the product inside contained regulated material, it was quickly transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The top of the box was mildly soaked, the jerrican's sealant was defective and resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.
